These plants are characterized by their distinctive bell-shaped flowers that often have a lobed or winged appearance. They typically grow in temperate regions and are found in various habitats such as meadows, woodlands, and rocky areas. Pterotheca species usually have hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and they produce small, often blue or violet flowers. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
